title: WATCH:  Bear captured after wandering onto Tampa International Airport property
description: The juvenile bear was relocated to Ocala National Forest.

title: Natalee Holloway family hopeful after Joran van der Sloot's extradition
description: A spokesperson for Natalee Holloway's family spoke to "GMA3" after last week's extradition of Joran van der Sloot to the U.S. on federal extortion and wire fraud charges.

title: Jack Teixeira, alleged classified documents leaker, indicted by federal grand jury
description: Jack Teixeira, the member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard accused of leaking classified documents online, has been indicted by a federal grand jury.

title: Black teacher sues school after alleged firing over book complaints
description: A former North Carolina teacher claims he was fired in February after parents complained about him teaching the book "Dear Martin."

title: US government agencies hit by cyberattack, official says
description: U.S. government networks were hit by a cyberattack affecting several agencies, but the attack does not pose a major risk to national security, an official said Thursday

title: Police responding to 'mass casualty collision' on highway in Canada
description: Authorities are responding to a "mass casualty collision" that occurred Wednesday on a highway in Canada, Royal Canadian Mounted Police said.

title: Trump rejected his lawyer's effort to propose settlement in docs case
description: Former President Trump last fall rejected a proposal from one of his attorneys who was trying to keep him from being charged in the DOJ's documents probe, sources say.

title: Bear captured after wandering onto Tampa International Airport property
description: A Florida black bear seen walking on Tampa International Airport property was captured on Wednesday.

title: 2 hurt in shooting near Denver Nuggets' championship parade
description: Two people were hurt in a shooting in Denver on Thursday as residents gathered at a parade for the Denver Nuggets, who won their first NBA title on Monday night.

title: NOAA announces record-breaking ocean temperatures
description: Ocean temperatures reached record-breaking highs for the month of May, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration announced.

title: Bill Cosby sued by 9 women who claim they were drugged, sexually assaulted
description: Nine women filed a lawsuit against actor and comedian Bill Cosby, accusing him of drugging and sexually assaulting them.

title: Supreme Court upholds law giving Native American families priority in adoption
description: A white couple seeking to adopt Native American children had challenged the law.

title: Ukraine making 'steady progress' in counteroffensive, top US general says
description: Ukraine is making "steady progress" in its offensive, a top U.S. general said Thursday.

title: Police investigating mysterious death of college student found lying in the road
description: Police said they are investigating the death of Mia Kanu, a college student found in critical condition lying in the road earlier after somehow exiting a vehicle.

title: Patients with HIV in US saw rise of rare, deadly bacterial illness last year: CDC
description: A new CDC report found that HIV patients in the U.S. saw a rise of a rare, deadly bacterial illness in 2022 due to low vaccination rates.

title: International donors commit $10.3 billion in aid for millions of Syrians battered by civil conflict, hunger, poverty
description: International donors commit $10.3 billion in aid for millions of Syrians battered by civil conflict, hunger, poverty

title: Average long-term US mortgage rate falls to 6.69%, second straight drop since climbing to 2023 high
description: The average long-term U.S. mortgage rate fell again this week, positive news for potential homebuyers after rates reached their highest level since November earlier this month

title: US offers to drop some charges for now against Sam Bankman-Fried
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, who has pleaded not guilty, is scheduled to stand trial in October.

title: American tourist dies after attack near Germany's famous Neuschwanstein castle
description: An American tourist was killed and another was injured when they were attacked by an American man they met near the famous Neuschwanstein castle in southern Germany.

title: Songwriter, music industry entrepreneur sentenced to life in girlfriend's death
description: A songwriter and music industry entrepreneur from Atlanta has been sentenced to life in prison without parole for killing his girlfriend in Iowa

title: WATCH:  Intense hail batters Arkansas lakes as severe storms move through region
description: Parts of Arkansas were hit by large hail as severe thunderstorms rolled through the region.

title: FDA advisers consider changing COVID vaccine to target latest omicron strain
description: The COVID-19 vaccines are on track for a big recipe change this fall

title: Security firm: Chinese hackers broke into email security appliance in spying campaign
description: The U.S. cybersecurity firm Mandiant says suspected state-backed Chinese hackers exploited a vulnerability in a popular email security appliance to break into the networks of hundreds of public and private sector organizations globally, nearly a third ...

title: Tornado watch issued in South as severe weather outbreak continues: Latest
description: More severe weather is slamming the U.S. on Thursday, with residents from Florida to Kansas bracing for impact.

title: Man attacks 2 women near Neuschwanstein castle in Germany, killing one
description: Authorities say a tourist has died after a man attacked her and a companion near Neuschwanstein castle in southern Germany

title: Two-time Oscar winner Glenda Jackson, who mixed acting with politics, dies at 87
description: Glenda Jackson, a two-time Academy Award-winning performer who had a long second career as a British lawmaker, has died

title: Vatican releases first photos of Pope Francis recovering from surgery
description: The Vatican press office released photos on Thursday of Pope Francis recovering after undergoing intestinal surgery.

title: Retail sales rose 0.3% in May despite pressure from higher inflation and interest rates
description: Americans increased their spending at retailers last month despite pressure from still-high inflation and rising borrowing costs

title: Number of Americans filing for jobless claims is elevated for second straight week
description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits remained elevated last week, a possible sign that the Federal Reserve’s interest rate hikes over the past year may taking hold in what’s been a resilient job market

title: UN atomic watchdog chief visits Ukraine nuclear plant threatened by war with Russia
description: The head of the United Nations nuclear watchdog is visiting Europe’s largest atomic power plant in southern Ukraine

title: North Korea fires 'unidentified ballistic missile,' South Korean military says
description: North Korea fired "an unidentified ballistic missile" toward the East Sea on Thursday, South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said.

title: How some of Donald Trump's business allies are reacting to federal indictment
description: The allies weighed in on the charges and their effect on major donations.

title: Boris Johnson 'deliberately misled' UK Parliament over 'partygate,' committee says
description: Former U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson "deliberately misled" Parliament about so-called partygate, a committee of lawmakers said in a scathing report on Thursday.

title: Bill Cosby sued by 9 more women in Nevada
description: Nine more women are accusing Bill Cosby of sexual assault in a lawsuit that alleges he used what they call his “enormous power, fame and prestige” to victimize them

title: Germany to give $1.4 billion to Holocaust survivors globally in 2024
description: The organization that handles claims on behalf of Jews who suffered under the Nazis says that Germany has agreed to extend another $1.4 billion overall for Holocaust survivors around the globe for the coming year

title: Idaho college murders case prompts prosecution request for big budget hike
description: Prosecutors in Moscow, Idaho, this week said the upcoming prosecution of Bryan Kohberger could cost more than eight times their entire annual trial budget.

title: Robert Gottlieb, celebrated literary editor, dies at 92
description: One of the greatest literary editors in modern times, Robert Gottlieb, has died

title: 2 Americans found dead in hotel room in Baja California Sur, Mexico: Police
description: Two Americans were found dead in their hotel room in Baja California Sur, Mexico, on Tuesday, local police told ABC News.

title: 2 Americans found dead at hotel in Mexico's Baja California Sur
description: Police in a seaside community on Mexico's Baja California peninsula say two Americans have been found dead in their hotel room

title: Australia to seek to stop Russia building embassy near Parliament House
description: The Australian government expects to introduce legislation to prevent Russia from building a new embassy near Parliament House on security grounds

title: University of Delaware agrees to settle class-action suit over COVID campus shutdown
description: The University of Delaware has agreed to pay $6.3 million to settle a lawsuit over its campus shutdown and the halting of in-person classes amid the coronavirus pandemic

title: WATCH:  Wild platypuses duke it out in Tasmania
description: Two wild platypuses were caught on camera engaging in combat which the local resident who captured the footage believes was a fight over territory.
